adjective.description: Chiefly in or with reference to royal letters, decrees, etc., prefixed to the name or designation of a lord: highly esteemed or honoured. Usually in "(right) trusty and well-beloved".

noun.description: A dearly loved person. Chiefly with possessive adjective.

origin: Late Middle English; earliest use found in Geoffrey Chaucer (c1340–1400), poet and administrator. From well + beloved.
